intro: Syngonanthus glandulifer, commonly known as the glandular thyme. This plant is a flowering shrub native to South Africa, characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is known for its glandular structures on its leaves and stems, which secrete oils. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to Mediterranean climates. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its fragrant foliage and long blooming period.
